author: Unreal Engine
description:
In ‘Lords of the Fallen’, CI Games Mediterranean Projects SL customized Unreal Engine’s AI systems to meet the demands of a fast-paced, modular, and scalable AI ecosystem—one that supports rapid iteration and is designed to extend across future titles in the franchise.  

This talk recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm takes a deep dive into key AI systems for combat: perception, targeting, aggro handling, and decision-making. 

CI Games explores how they combined Unreal Engine’s classic Behavior Trees with the newer State Trees to build a scalable behavior selection system capable of handling both environmental and combat-driven reactions. 

They also discuss the navigation challenges of a large-scale game world filled with diverse enemies of varying sizes and complexity.  

Presented in a post-mortem style, they share real production issues and solutions from Lords of the Fallen, and how those solutions evolved for the next title. 

Get practical insights on how they integrated the Game
title: Crafting Scalable AI for a AAA Souls-Like Game in Unreal Engine | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm, we explore the journey Unreal Engine has been on when it comes to managing large numbers of shaders and long compilation times. 

We begin with an overview of the numerous facets of this problem, and an explanation of how they coalesce to make the lives of rendering engineers and content creators difficult.

From there, we deep dive into all of the recent and not-quite-so-recent improvements in this area, using the City Sample as a case study to see the impact of all these changes in a practical example.

Finally, we provide an overview of the next steps in this space, with a peek at various additional engine-level improvements we hope to tackle over the next few versions that will continue to alleviate some of these issues systematically.

You’ll gain an understanding of the various components of the UE shader system, how they fit together, and all of the recent changes that were introduced to minimize shader compilation and cook tim
title: Managing Unbounded Growth: A Story of Shaders in UE | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In 2019, five Unreal Engine evangelists gathered at Unreal Fest Prague to deliver an ambitious talk: 100 UE4 Tips and Tricks.

Despite their best efforts, they famously ended with only 69 tips, leaving unfinished business.

Since then, the legendary EU evangelism team has scattered, their whereabouts unknown, and their Unreal secrets seemingly lost to time. Now, in 2025, Epic Games’ own Ari Arnbjörnsson is determined to finish what they started. 

He's assembling a crew once thought impossible to reunite, pulling together familiar faces and forgotten heroes for one last epic mission: finally sharing 100 tips, plus one more for good measure, in one single unforgettable presentation. 

Will Ari succeed in getting the band back together? Can they complete their original mission, or will history repeat itself? 

Watch this session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm to find out, and witness a legendary reunion. Some debts can only be paid in tips and tricks.

Learn more about Unreal Engine
title: 101 Unreal Engine Tips & Tricks: The Reckoning | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025
